page.title: 09 Whitemoor Coalmine
page.content: Building began in January 1980 and the mine is still under construction. The first coalface will be working in 1986. Coal output is low at the development stage, although coal is being produced on a pro-rata of 50% coal to 50% rock. A rough estimate would be 150-200 tons per shift. The National Coal Board being such a large customer, there are many firms involved with the mine. For example, Thysson (GB) are dealing with the shafts and tunnels whilst Fairclough Construction LTD deal with surface buildings. Several firms provide the wide variety of machinery. This machinery includes a huge grab to lift the broken rock into large buckets to send out of the shaft and drilling rigs to probe down to 100 metres for water.
